api:field.name: overview-html

api:html-text.plain-text:
I am a Senior Lecturer (Associate Professor) in Large-scale Data Fusion at Sheffield University. My research interests include Pervasive Computing, Healthcare Informatics, Data Analytics and Internet of Things. Since 2006, I have generated over 90 international journal (35 IEEE Journal/Trans) and conference papers in the fields of Pervasive Healthcare, Large-scale Data Fusion, Parallel Computing and RFID related internet of things (IoT) applications. I serve as an Associate Editor in IEEE Journal of Translational Engineering in Health and Medicine and IEEE Access.
I graduated with a BSc (hons) in Computer Science from Wuhan University in China in 2004, an M.Sc in Computer Science from the University of Bristol in 2006 and a Ph.D in Electronic Engineering from the University of Staffordshire in 2010. From February 2015 to July 2019, I have been working as a Senior Lecturer in Computer Science at Liverpool John Moores University. From January 2012 to January 2015, I work as a Post-doc Research Fellow in Computer Science at the University of Bedfordshire, with the additional role of leading Research Assistants and Ph.D students. Previously, I have held positions as a Research Associate in Computer Science at the University of Teesside from September 2008 to February 2010, a Research Assistant in image processing at the University of Salford from March 2010 to December 2011.
I have over 12 years full time research experience in computing areas (recent three years working on Pervasive Healthcare), which includes the key participation and local leadership of 6 EU funded projects CALLAS (RA in Affective Computing at Teesside University), IMPACT (RA in Image Processing at Salford University), GPSME, DRINVENTOR, MHA and CHIC (RF in Computer science at Bedfordshire University) and 3 EPSRC/TSB funded projects.
